page.title: 18INTERVIEW-continued
page.content: of pessimism.Being fit and healthy is an essential for rural living, so when the taking of long walks is no longer possible they feel moving to Sherborne will be inevitable. As for the future of the village they showed great concern.They hope that it will remain unspoilt but fear that with the impending sale of the 'big house',Compton Castle,changes must take place.They fear that traffic will increase in the village and a new venture at the house could prove detrimental to the rural peace e.g. a residential retreat for those recovering from mental illness or perhaps a 'drying out' clinic.At best they hope it will be sold as a country hotel or hospitality house for some transnational company. In conclusion they were well pleased with their retirement choice.
